raw_body:
As a data scientist, are you driving product decisions? Or just supporting them? The right questions can turn AI from a threat into your career’s best ally. Here’s how to start asking them.
The post The Art of Asking Good Questions appeared first on Towards Data Science.
speedrun: Data scientists often find themselves in a supporting role rather than leading product decisions. By asking the right questions, they can leverage AI to enhance their influence and career prospects. This shift is crucial as AI becomes an integral part of decision-making processes. Understanding how to frame questions effectively could empower data scientists to take charge in their roles.
why_it_matters: Data scientists can enhance their roles by asking insightful questions, leading to more impactful contributions. This shift could improve team dynamics and project outcomes.
As AI integration deepens in product development, the ability to ask the right questions signifies a broader trend toward data-driven decision-making across industries.

lenses.eli12: When data scientists ask better questions, they can help shape product decisions instead of just following orders. Imagine a coach who not only trains players but also decides game strategies. This shift matters because it can lead to more innovative products that truly meet user needs.
lenses.pm: For product managers and founders, encouraging data scientists to ask the right questions can lead to better insights and more informed decisions. This could reduce costs and improve efficiency in product development. It’s about harnessing the full potential of data to drive success.
lenses.engineer: From a technical standpoint, asking the right questions can lead to more effective data analysis and model development. It encourages a focus on relevant metrics and outcomes, which can enhance the performance of AI systems. This approach could lead to more robust solutions tailored to specific user needs.
